name: Name and territory of the Union
description: India is a Union of States, and its territory includes states, union territories, and any acquired territories.

name: Admission or establishment of new States
description: Parliament may admit or establish new states on terms it determines.

name: Formation of new States and alteration of areas, boundaries, or names
description: Parliament can change the boundaries or names of states and form new ones.

name: Laws made under Articles 2 and 3
description: Laws under Articles 2 and 3 are not considered constitutional amendments.

name: Equality before the law
description: Guarantees equality before the law and equal protection of the laws for everyone.

name: Prohibition of discrimination
description: Prohibits discrimination on grounds of religion, race, caste, sex, or place of birth.

name: Equality of opportunity in public employment
description: Ensures equal opportunity in government jobs but allows reservations for backward classes.

name: Abolition of Untouchability
description: Untouchability is abolished and its practice in any form is forbidden.

name: Abolition of Titles
description: Prohibits the state from conferring titles except for military or academic distinctions.

name: Protection of certain rights regarding freedom of speech, etc.
description: Guarantees freedom of speech, assembly, movement, residence, and profession.

name: Protection in respect of conviction for offences
description: Provides protection against double jeopardy, self-incrimination, and ex post facto laws.

name: Protection of life and personal liberty
description: No person shall be deprived of life or personal liberty except according to procedure established by law.

name: Right to education
description: Free and compulsory education for children aged 6 to 14 years.

name: Protection against arrest and detention
description: Provides rights related to preventive detention and arrest procedures.
